headline: New LNG and Kuwait Contracts Might Change The Case For Investing In Baker Hughes (BKR)
summary: In December 2025, Technip Energies issued a Full Notice To Proceed for Baker Hughes to supply six LM9000-based refrigerant turbo compressors and related liquefaction equipment for Commonwealth LNG’s export facility in Cameron, Louisiana, while Kuwait Oil Company awarded Baker Hughes multi-year artificial lift and wireline service contracts to support production in its fields. Together, these LNG and production-optimization wins highlight how Baker Hughes’ gas technology, digital automation,...

Together, these LNG and production-optimization wins highlight how Baker Hughes’ gas technology, digital automation,...

headline: Baker Hughes (BKR): Assessing Valuation After New LNG Contract Win and Analyst Upgrades
summary: Baker Hughes (BKR) is back in focus after securing a Full Notice To Proceed from Technip Energies to supply key liquefaction equipment for Commonwealth LNG's Louisiana export facility, underscoring its growing role in global LNG infrastructure. See our latest analysis for Baker Hughes. The Commonwealth LNG award and recent contract wins in Kuwait arrive after a choppy few months, with a 30 day share price return of minus 6.79 percent but a robust 5 year total shareholder return of 147.95...

headline: Is It Too Late To Consider Baker Hughes After Its Strong Multi Year Share Price Run?
summary: If you are wondering whether Baker Hughes is still a smart buy after its big multiyear run, or if most of the upside is already priced in, this piece is for you. The stock is up 147.9% over five years and 68.1% over three years, but more recently it has slipped 6.8% over the last month while still holding a 9.6% gain year to date and 15.9% over the past year. Those mixed returns come against a backdrop of steady contract wins in LNG and offshore services, ongoing commitments to lower carbon...
